Proposed change: Add a static reload function. The function will simply replace the current static instance by a new one.

Do not allocated a pinned GCHandle

Per MSDN
(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/vstudio/a95009h1(v=vs.100).asp
x), an attempt to pin a GCHandle for a non-blittable type should throw
an argument exception. The type System.Delegate is non-blittable.

The version of Mono used by Unity does not throw an exception, but the
IL2CPP scripting backend does throw this exception. Therefore, this
code does not work with IL2CPP.

However, it should not be necessary to pin this GCHandle. A normal mode
handle should ensures that the managed object will not be collected.

"extra-doge" release.

"extra-doge" release.

This adds support for Saved Games in Unity, and introduces code samples that take advantage of Unity 4.6 APIs.

Keep non-incremental achievements with progress <100 locked

For incremental achievements, the expected behavior for progress values
less than 100.0 is that the achievement remains locked (and displays
partial progress).  Non-incremental achievements should be treated the
same way.  By doing so, it can be left to the administrator of the
Google Play app to decide what type is most appropriate for an
achievement, and the developer need only report partial progress as
normal and the correct behavior will still happen.

Normalize achievements progress when specified as a percentage

When using ReportProgress, the documentation states that "a progress of
0.0 will reveal the achievement and 100.0 will unlock it."  Prior to
this commit, the ``progress`` parameter actually expects a value
between 0.0 and 1.0.
